text: city noise got nothing on seagulls squawking at dawn when i had my bunk near docks – imagine your alarm clock but it flies and steals your breakfast too
ever heard karaoke till dawn? welcome to my world
pipes can't beat reel machinery clank at dawn
back when i was living closer quarters had neighbors who thought their karaoke skills were top-notch... they weren't – sounded more like cats squabbling at midnight!
can't say i share your enthusiasm for street performers though; where i stroll they're more loud than talented – makes you miss simple silence sometimes
old pier always brings me back to simpler times
bustling markets got their charm for sure but they can't beat quiet spots where thoughts aren't drowned out by chaos - gotta have balance!
felt grown up too soon taking over family fishing business after dad passed - no choice but deal with whatever sea threw our way
fishermen tales aren't all tall trust me
time at sea makes you love quiet moments ashore like nothing else. spotting fishy deals comes naturally too after years of haggling over catches!

manila here has its share of 'you made it' parties when you hit big three-o. sure we have some old-school folks fussing on life goals but these days it feels less pressure more gradual y’know? just another day fishing in life’s sea tbh.
sea’s always been part of me dudes
sea breeze n' salty air - toughens you up good

i hear ya - grew up around boats n' nets myself. had its charm but life wasn’t all calm seas and sunny shores if ya catch my drift? even after years out at sea everytime i see those familiar coastlines it feels nostalgic yet always reminds me that progress doesn’t mean forgetting our roots, just learning from 'em!
hometowns do shape us but can't ignore some traditions needed updating, saw plenty first-hand over years at sea where some old ways don’t fly anymore – gotta adapt to stay afloat!
hometown influences sure but doesn't define us
